name: tajine bread
ingredients: 1 tbsp of baker's yeast dissolved in a little warm water with 1 tbsp of powdered sugar
1 and a half tsp of salt
Warm water (to bring the dough together)
A little semolina (to coat the dough)
steps: In a mixing bowl, thoroughly mix the flour, oil, dissolved yeast, salt, and warm water (add water gradually) until you get a smooth and soft dough. Knead vigorously.
Cover the dough and place it in a warm spot to rise (it should double in size).
Deflate the dough. Divide it into portions. Shape them into balls and coat them with fine semolina (if desired).
Flatten the balls to form discs 1 to 2 cm thick. Let them rise again under a cloth for about 15 minutes.
Heat your tajine (earthenware cooking dish) or a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat.
Cook the discs for 5 minutes on each side until they are golden brown and cooked through. Enjoy warm.
